parameter.label: space slug
parameter.tooltip: Space slug of the submission

parameter.label: submission id
parameter.tooltip: Submission Id of the robot schedule record

parameter.label: start time
parameter.tooltip: The time from which the next schedule should be determined. Usually the current time, unless this is for a new schedule.

parameter.label: schedule update time
parameter.tooltip: Schedule update time (for the initial routine call), or current time (for subsequent calls).

parameter.label: Initial Run
parameter.tooltip: Set to false when this routine calls itself; any other value when called the first time (when a submission is submitted or modified)

parameter.label: Wait time:
parameter.tooltip: Time you want to wait for deferred task

parameter.label: Time unit:
parameter.tooltip: Unit of measurement for time (Seconds, Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks)

parameters.parameter:
<%= inputs = {} inputs["Kinetic Robot Execution Record Id"]=@results['Create execution record']['Id'] inputs["Kinetic Robot Deferral Token"]=@results['Defer routine execution']['deferral_token']
prev_execution = JSON.parse( @results['Retrieve previous execution']['Submissions List JSON'] ) if prev_execution.empty? inputs["Kinetic Robot Previous Execution Output"] = {} else inputs["Kinetic Robot Previous Execution Output"] = JSON.parse( prev_execution[0]['values']['Output'] ) end
inputs["Runtime Inputs"]=JSON.parse( JSON.parse( @results['Recheck submission']['Values JSON'] )['Runtime Inputs'] || "{}" )
inputs.to_json%>
The schedule changed since this execution initiated, which stopes processing on this thread. A separate thread will processing the updated schedule.

task.name: Notes on if routine cannot be executed
Schedule changed; new run has been initiated

parameters.parameter: This ensures that if the task engine was stopped while multiple changes were happening, it validates against the submission details and not the retrieved values.

parameter.label: Start (UTC)
parameter.tooltip: The time when the schedule should begin looking for the next occurrence. Enter in a parsable Ruby time (standard Request CE Datetime field works; ex format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+00:00).

parameters.parameter:
<%= schedule = JSON.parse(@results['Get submission']['Values JSON'])
if schedule['Recurrence'] == "minutely" @inputs['start time'] elsif schedule['Recurrence'] == "hourly" execution_hour = Time.parse( @inputs['start time'] ).hour execution_minute = schedule['Execution Minute'] Time.parse( "#{execution_hour}:#{execution_minute}", Time.parse( @inputs['start time'] ) ) else execution_hour = schedule['Execution Hour'] execution_minute = schedule['Execution Minute'] Time.parse( "#{execution_hour}:#{execution_minute}", Time.parse( @inputs['start time'] ) ) end %>

parameter.label: Recurrence Type
parameter.tooltip: Valid options are 'minutely' [requires interval],'hourly' [requires interval],'daily' [requires interval],'weekly' [requires interval],'monthly' [requires timing, interval and either weekdays or days of month],'yearly' [requires timing, interval, months, and either weekdays or days of month]

parameter.label: Timing
parameter.tooltip: Requires for monthly and yearly Recurrence Types. Valid options are 'Relative' or 'Absolute'. Relative refers to relatives dates (ex: First Monday in May and June) and Absolute refers to specific dates (ex: 7th and 10th of June)

parameter.label: Interval
parameter.tooltip: The interval between the recurrence_type values.

parameter.label: Months
parameter.tooltip: The months in which this schedule should execute. Possible vales are entered in array format, with the values of 'January', 'February', 'March', 'April', 'May', 'June', 'July', 'August', 'September', 'October', 'November', 'December'. Any combination of values is fine. Example: ['January', 'April', 'July', 'October']

parameters.parameter: <%= #Input needs to be a comma separated list JSON.parse(@results['Get submission']['Values JSON'])['Months'].join(",")%>

parameter.label: Days of Month
parameter.tooltip: The dates on which this schedule should execute. Possible vales are entered in array format, with the values of 1 through 31, and 'last'. Any combination of values is fine. Example: ['1', '15', 'Last']

parameters.parameter: <%= #Input needs to be a comma separated list JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['Days'].join(",")%>

parameter.label: Weekdays
parameter.tooltip: The weekdays in which this schedule should execute. Possible vales are entered in array format, with the values of 'Sunday', 'Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday', 'Saturday'. Any combination of values is fine. Example: ['Monday', 'Thursday', 'Saturday']

parameters.parameter: <%= ##Input needs to be a comma separated list JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['Weekdays'].join(",")%>

parameter.label: Sunday Index
parameter.tooltip: Required when Sunday field is populated AND recurrence type is NOT weekly. Possible values are entered in array format, with the values of 'All', 'First, 'Second', 'Third', 'Fourth', 'Last'. 'All' is exclusive to other values. If not using 'All', any combination of other values is fine. Example 1: ['All'], Example 2: ['First','Second','Last']

parameters.parameter: <%= #Input needs to be a comma separated list JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['Sunday Index'].join(",")%>

parameter.label: Monday Index
parameter.tooltip: Required when Monday field is populated AND recurrence type is NOT weekly. Possible values are entered in array format, with the values of 'All', 'First, 'Second', 'Third', 'Fourth', 'Last'. 'All' is exclusive to other values. If not using 'All', any combination of other values is fine. Example 1: ['All'], Example 2: ['First','Second','Last']

parameters.parameter: <%= ##Input needs to be a comma separated list JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['Monday Index'].join(",")%>

parameter.label: Tuesday Index
parameter.tooltip: Required when Tuesday field is populated AND recurrence type is NOT weekly. Possible values are entered in array format, with the values of 'All', 'First, 'Second', 'Third', 'Fourth', 'Last'. 'All' is exclusive to other values. If not using 'All', any combination of other values is fine. Example 1: ['All'], Example 2: ['First','Second','Last']

parameters.parameter: <%= #Input needs to be a comma separated list JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['Tuesday Index'].join(",")%>

parameter.label: Wednesday Index
parameter.tooltip: Required when Wednesday field is populated AND recurrence type is NOT weekly. Possible values are entered in array format, with the values of 'All', 'First, 'Second', 'Third', 'Fourth', 'Last'. 'All' is exclusive to other values. If not using 'All', any combination of other values is fine. Example 1: ['All'], Example 2: ['First','Second','Last']

parameters.parameter: <%= ##Input needs to be a comma separated list JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['Wednesday Index'].join(",")%>

parameter.label: Thursday Index
parameter.tooltip: Required when Thursday field is populated AND recurrence type is NOT weekly. Possible values are entered in array format, with the values of 'All', 'First, 'Second', 'Third', 'Fourth', 'Last'. 'All' is exclusive to other values. If not using 'All', any combination of other values is fine. Example 1: ['All'], Example 2: ['First','Second','Last']

parameters.parameter: <%= #Input needs to be a comma separated list JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['Thursday Index'].join(",")%>

parameter.label: Friday Index
parameter.tooltip: Required when Friday field is populated AND recurrence type is NOT weekly. Possible values are entered in array format, with the values of 'All', 'First, 'Second', 'Third', 'Fourth', 'Last'. 'All' is exclusive to other values. If not using 'All', any combination of other values is fine. Example 1: ['All'], Example 2: ['First','Second','Last']

parameters.parameter: <%= #Input needs to be a comma separated list JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['Friday Index'].join(",")%>

parameter.label: Saturday Index
parameter.tooltip: Required when Saturday field is populated AND recurrence type is NOT weekly. Possible values are entered in array format, with the values of 'All', 'First, 'Second', 'Third', 'Fourth', 'Last'. 'All' is exclusive to other values. If not using 'All', any combination of other values is fine. Example 1: ['All'], Example 2: ['First','Second','Last']

parameters.parameter: <%= #Input needs to be a comma separated list JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['Saturday Index'].join(",")%>

task.label: Future Time
task.value: JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['End Date'].nil? || JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['End Date'].empty? || ( !( JSON.parse(@results['Get submission']['Values JSON'])['End Date'].nil? ) && !( JSON.parse(@results['Get submission']['Values JSON'])['End Date'].empty? ) && ( ( Time.parse( @results['Determine next execution']['next_occurrence'] ) - Time.parse( JSON.parse(@results['Get submission']['Values JSON'])['End Date'] ) ).to_i < 0) )

task.label: After end date
task.value: ( !( JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['End Date'].nil? ) && !( JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['End Date'].empty? ) && ( ( Time.parse( @results['Determine next execution']['next_occurrence'] ) - Time.parse( JSON.parse( @results['Get submission']['Values JSON'] )['End Date'] ) ).to_i >= 0 ) )

parameter.label: space slug
parameter.tooltip: Space slug of the submission

parameter.label: submission id
parameter.tooltip: Submission Id of the robot schedule record

parameter.label: start time
parameter.tooltip: The time from which the next schedule should be determined. Usually the current time, unless this is for a new schedule.

parameter.label: schedule update time
parameter.tooltip: Schedule update time (for the initial routine call), or current time (for subsequent calls).

parameter.label: Initial Run
parameter.tooltip: Set to false when this routine calls itself; any other value when called the first time (when a submission is submitted or modified)

parameter.label: Id
parameter.tooltip: The Id of the submission to retrieve

parameter.label: Form Slug
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Form to find submissions in.

parameter.label: Index To Search
parameter.tooltip: The Index definition to search (i.e. values[Name],values[Status])

parameter.label: Core State
parameter.tooltip: Searches for submissions that have a core state that matches this parameter. If no value is provided, the results will contain submissions in all core states.

parameter.label: Limit
parameter.tooltip: Limit the number of results returned. If not provided, the server will limit the results to 25 submissions. Maximum limit 1000

parameter.label: Query
parameter.tooltip: Query to use to fetch submissions. (i.e values[First Name]="Fred")

parameter.label: Next Page Token
parameter.tooltip: The value to use as the offset for the page of submissions to return. The submission that matches this value will not be included in the results.

parameter.label: Recipient List
parameter.tooltip: Comma separated list of recipients (Usernames, SMTP Addresses, and/or Team Names)

parameter.label: Notification Template Name
parameter.tooltip: Name of the notification template to use when sending this email

parameters.parameter: <%=JSON.parse(@results['Get submission']['Values JSON'])['Schedule Completion Notification Message Template']%>

parameter.label: JSON Variables
parameter.tooltip: JSON input of miscellaneous values. These values are used to replace placeholder content in notification messages.

parameters.parameter:
<%=
{
  #"Robot Name" => JSON.parse(@results['Get submission']['Values JSON'])['Schedule Name'],
  #"Robot Id" => @results['Get submission']['Id']
}.to_json%>

parameter.label: Kapp Slug Initiating Notification
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Kapp sending the notification (ex: services, queue, etc.)

parameter.label: Related Submission Id
parameter.tooltip: Id of the submission to get values for, required if using those or attachments in the message

parameter.label: Form Slug Initiating Notification
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Form sending the notification (ex: work-order, cleaning, etc.)

parameter.label: Is Datastore
parameter.tooltip: If the Related Submission Id, or Form Slug is a datastore form.

parameter.label: Form Slug
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Form to find submissions in.

parameter.label: Index To Search
parameter.tooltip: The Index definition to search (i.e. values[Name],values[Status])

parameter.label: Core State
parameter.tooltip: Searches for submissions that have a core state that matches this parameter. If no value is provided, the results will contain submissions in all core states.

parameter.label: Limit
parameter.tooltip: Limit the number of results returned. If not provided, the server will limit the results to 25 submissions. Maximum limit 1000

parameter.label: Query
parameter.tooltip: Query to use to fetch submissions. (i.e values[First Name]="Fred")

parameter.label: Next Page Token
parameter.tooltip: The value to use as the offset for the page of submissions to return. The submission that matches this value will not be included in the results.

parameter.label: Form Slug
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Form to create the submission in

parameter.label: Current Page Name
parameter.tooltip: The page to set the submission to

parameter.label: Current Page Navigation
parameter.tooltip: The direction of the next page (next or previous)

parameter.label: Values JSON
parameter.tooltip: A JSON Map of values to set into the submissions fields

parameters.parameter:
<%={
'Robot ID' => @inputs['submission id'],
'Next Execution' => Time.parse( @results['Determine next execution']['next_occurrence'] ).utc.iso8601
}.to_json%>

parameter.label: Form Slug
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Form to create the submission in

parameter.label: Current Page Name
parameter.tooltip: The page to set the submission to

parameter.label: Current Page Navigation
parameter.tooltip: The direction of the next page (next or previous)

parameter.label: Values JSON
parameter.tooltip: A JSON Map of values to set into the submissions fields

parameters.parameter: <%= runtime_inputs = JSON.parse(@results['Recheck submission']['Values JSON'])['Runtime Inputs'] || "{}" { "Robot ID" => @inputs['submission id'], "Robot Name" => JSON.parse(@results['Recheck submission']['Values JSON'])['Robot Name'], "Start" => @results['Capture Execution Start Time']['output'], "Input" => (runtime_inputs).gsub(/\\/,'\\\\\\\\').gsub(/"/,'\"'), "Status" => "Queued", "Deferral Token" => @results['Defer routine execution']['deferral_token'] }.to_json%>

parameter.label: Form Slug
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Form to find submissions in.

parameter.label: Index To Search
parameter.tooltip: The Index definition to search (i.e. values[Name],values[Status])

parameter.label: Core State
parameter.tooltip: Searches for submissions that have a core state that matches this parameter. If no value is provided, the results will contain submissions in all core states.

parameter.label: Direction
parameter.tooltip: Result Set sorting direction. The default value is ascending.

parameter.label: Limit
parameter.tooltip: Limit the number of results returned. If not provided, the server will limit the results to 25 submissions. Maximum limit 1000

parameter.label: Query
parameter.tooltip: Query to use to fetch submissions. (i.e values[First Name]="Fred")

parameter.label: Next Page Token
parameter.tooltip: The value to use as the offset for the page of submissions to return. The submission that matches this value will not be included in the results.

parameter.label: Source
parameter.tooltip: Use '-' for a global routine.

parameter.label: Group
parameter.tooltip: Use '-' for any routine.

parameter.label: Name
parameter.tooltip: The workflow (tree/routine) name to run.

parameter.label: Body
parameter.tooltip: A JSON string of name/value pairs that will be passed to the tree as body content.

parameter.label: Recipient List
parameter.tooltip: Comma separated list of recipients (Usernames, SMTP Addresses, and/or Team Names)

parameter.label: Notification Template Name
parameter.tooltip: Name of the notification template to use when sending this email

parameters.parameter: <%=JSON.parse(@results['Recheck submission']['Values JSON'])['Run Completion Notification Message Template']%>

parameter.label: JSON Variables
parameter.tooltip: JSON input of miscellaneous values. These values are used to replace placeholder content in notification messages.

parameters.parameter:
<%=
{
  #"Schedule Name" => JSON.parse(@results['Get submission']['Values JSON'])['Schedule Name'],
  #"Schedule Id" => @results['Get submission']['ID'],
  "Execution Id" => @results['Create execution record']['Submission ID']
}.to_json%>

parameter.label: Kapp Slug Initiating Notification
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Kapp sending the notification (ex: services, queue, etc.)

parameter.label: Related Submission Id
parameter.tooltip: Id of the submission to get values for, required if using those or attachments in the message

parameter.label: Form Slug Initiating Notification
parameter.tooltip: The slug of the Form sending the notification (ex: work-order, cleaning, etc.)

parameter.label: Is Datastore
parameter.tooltip: If the Related Submission Id, or Form Slug is a datastore form.

parameter.label: Id
parameter.tooltip: The id of the submission to update

parameter.label: Updated - Core State
parameter.tooltip: The submissions core state

parameter.label: Updated - Current Page Name
parameter.tooltip: The page to set the submission to

parameter.label: Updated - Current Page Navigation
parameter.tooltip: The direction of the next page (next or previous)

parameter.label: Updated - Values JSON
parameter.tooltip: A JSON representation of the submissions values

parameters.parameter:
<%= require 'time' now = Time.now()
#output = "No output - possibly manually completed due to error." output = {} if @results['Defer routine execution'] && @results['Defer routine execution'].has_key?('output') && !@results['Defer routine execution']['output'].nil? output = (@results['Defer routine execution']['output']).gsub(/\\/,'\\\\\\\\') end
#"Output" => (@results['Defer routine execution']['output']).gsub(/\\/,'\\\\\\\\').gsub(/"/,'\"') { "End" => now.utc.iso8601, "Execution Duration" => now - Time.parse(@results['Capture Execution Start Time']['output']), "Status" => "Completed", "Output" => output }.to_json %>

task.label: Notify
task.value: JSON.parse(@results['Recheck submission']['Values JSON'])['Notify Upon Each Run Completion'].downcase == "yes"

parameter.label: Id
parameter.tooltip: The id of the submission to update

parameter.tooltip: The direction of the next page (next or previous)

parameter.label: Updated - Values JSON
parameter.tooltip: A JSON representation of the submissions values

parameter.label: Id
parameter.tooltip: The id of the submission to update

parameters.parameter: <%=JSON.parse( @results['Find next execution record - Clear']['Submissions List JSON'] )[0][id]%>

parameter.tooltip: The page to set the submission to

parameter.label: Updated - Current Page Navigation
parameter.tooltip: The direction of the next page (next or previous)

parameter.tooltip: A JSON representation of the submissions values

task.label: Notify
task.value: JSON.parse(@results['Get submission']['Values JSON'])['Notify Upon Schedule Completion'].downcase == "yes" && !@inputs['Initial Run'].nil? && @inputs['Initial Run'].downcase == "false"

parameter.tooltip: The Id of the submission to retrieve
